document_data.name: Dholber Greene
document_data.mainbody:
'''Dholber Greene''' was a guest of [[Nortale's Hostel]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|''I'm grateful to be here. I am. But I thought we'd arrive as a family. Not like this...''|Dholber Greene}}
document_data.Description: Dholber was a dark-skinned [[human]] man with hazelnut eyes and trimmed gray beard. As a refugee, he was dressed in simple commoner's garb.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, as the [[Absolute crisis]] ravaged the [[Western Heartlands]], the city of Baldur's Gate became flooded with refugees. Dholber Greene was lucky enough to secure lodgings for himself and his daughter, [[Dwindling Greene]], at Nortale's Hostel that offered beds to the refugees. Dholber was tired and devastated by the loss of other members of the family, who did not make it to the Gate.
